revised_title: Differences in Crystalline Forms of Carbonate of Lime, Bitter-Spar, and Iron-Spar
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, investigates the primitive crystal forms of carbonate of lime, bitter-spar, and iron-spar. He finds that the angles of these crystals differ, proving that their forms are not the same. This discovery challenges the previous classification of these minerals and suggests that their crystalline forms depend on their chemical composition.
